name: Overnight Raisin Oatmeal Pancakes
author: Cindy Carnes
summary: We prepare these on Christmas Eve to eat for breakfast on Christmas Day before opening our gifts.
directions: In a medium bowl, mix together the oats and buttermilk
The next morning: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt
Make a well in the center, and pour in the oatmeal mixture, eggs, butter, and raisins
Allow batter to sit 20 minutes before cooking
If batter is too thick, add buttermilk 1 tablespoon at a time, until the batter reaches the desired consistency
Heat a lightly greased, large skillet or griddle over medium heat
Pour 1/4 cup batter onto the hot griddle for each cake
Cook pancakes until bubbles appear on top, flip, and cook until lightly browned on bottom
